meanings.definition: To make a series of quick, light tapping sounds.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys ticktacking on the table with her pencil during class.
meanings.sent2: The rain was ticktacking on the roof all night long.
meanings.sent3: The little bird was ticktacking on the window, trying to get in.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was ticktacking with excitement as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the clock ticktacking in the silence was soothing.

meanings.definition: A series of quick, light tapping sounds.
meanings.sent1: The ticktacking of the typewriter filled the room with a rhythmic melody.
meanings.sent2: The ticktacking of the woodpecker echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected ticktacking of raindrops on the tent woke them up.
meanings.sent4: The ticktacking of high heels on the marble floor signaled her arrival.
meanings.sent5: The ticktacking of the old clock was the only sound in the abandoned house.
